title: Update username display to 8-character alphanumeric format

requirements.text: Update the username generation function in backend/main.mo to produce 8-character alphanumeric usernames using both uppercase and lowercase letters mixed with numbers (e.g., 'A3x7K9m2', 'B5n2M8k1'). Keep all existing username generation logic and behavior intact - only change the format/presentation of the output.

quotes: usernames should continue to work as they do now. all that changes is the presentation. 8 characters alphanumeric both upper and lower

acceptanceCriteria: Usernames contain a mix of uppercase letters (A-Z), lowercase letters (a-z), and numbers (0-9)
All existing username generation logic and behavior remains unchanged
No 'Anon' prefix is added to usernames

requirements.text: Update all frontend components that display usernames (MessageBubble, Header, etc.) to render the new 8-character alphanumeric format. Ensure the display matches the backend format without modification.

quotes: 8 characters alphanumeric both upper and lower

acceptanceCriteria: All username displays across the application show the 8-character format
Usernames are rendered exactly as received from the backend without client-side transformation
Username display is consistent across all UI components

constraints: Do not add any caller checks or authentication - the site must remain fully anonymous
Do not change the existing username generation logic or behavior - only update the presentation format
Do not add any user identity verification or tracking mechanisms
nonGoals: Adding user authentication or login systems
Implementing caller checks or identity verification
Changing how usernames are generated or stored beyond the format
Adding username persistence or user accounts
